Description.Brief: Create a ADB controller instance.

Types.MaaControllerHandle: The handle of the created controller instance.

address.Description: The ADB serial of the target device.

type.Description: The type of the ADB controller. See MaaAdbControllerTypeEnum.

config.Description: The config of the ADB controller.

agent_path.Description: The path of the agent executable.

callback_arg.Description: The callback arg that will be passed to the callback function.

Description.Brief: Create a win32 controller instance.

Types.MaaControllerHandle: The handle of the created controller instance.

hWnd.Description: The win32 window handle to control. This can be retrieved by helpers provided in MaaToolkitWin32Window.h.

type.Description: The type of the win32 controller. See MaaWin32ControllerTypeEnum.

callback_arg.Description: The callback arg that will be passed to the callback function.

Description.Brief: Create a custom controller instance.

Types.MaaControllerHandle: The handle of the created controller instance.

handle.Description: The handle to your instance of custom controller. See MaaCustomControllerAPI.

handle_arg.Description: The arg that will be passed to the custom controller API.

callback_arg.Description: The callback arg that will be passed to the callback function.

Description.Brief: Free the controller instance.
Set options for a given controller instance.
Details: This function requires a given set of option keys and value types, otherwise this will fail. See MaaCtrlOptionEnum for details.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the option is set successfully.

ctrl.Description: The handle of the controller instance to set options for.

val_size.Description: The size of the option value.

Description.Brief: Get the status of a request identified by the given id.
Wait for the request identified by the given id to complete.
Check if the controller is connected.
Get the image buffer of the last screencap request.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the image buffer is retrieved successfully.

buffer.Description: The buffer that the image data will be stored in.

Description.Brief: Get the UUID of the controller.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the UUID is retrieved successfully.

buffer.Description: The buffer that the UUID will be stored in.

Description.Brief: The custom controller API.
Details: To create a custom controller, you need to implement this API.
You do not have to implement all the functions in this API. Instead, just implement the functions you need. Do note that if an unimplemented function is called, the framework will likely crash.

Description.Brief: Write result to buffer.
Write result to buffer.
Create an instance.

callback_arg.Description: The callback arg that will be passed to the callback function.

Description.Brief: Free the instance.
Set options for a given instance.
Details: This function requires a given set of option keys and value types, otherwise this will fail. See MaaInstOptionEnum for details.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the option is set successfully.

inst.Description: The handle of the instance to set options for.

val_size.Description: The size of the option value.

Description.Brief: Bind the instance to an initialized resource.
Details: See functions in MaaResource.h about how to create a resource.

Description.Brief: Bind the instance to an initialized controller.
Details: See functions in MaaController.h about how to create a controller.

Description.Brief: Check if the instance is initialized.
Register a custom recognizer to the instance.
Details: See MaaCustomRecognizer.h for details about how to create a custom recognizer.

name.Description: The name of the recognizer that will be used to reference it.

Description.Brief: Unregister a custom recognizer from the instance.

name.Description: The name of the recognizer when it was registered.

Description.Brief: Clear all custom recognizers registered to the instance.
Register a custom action to the instance.
Details: See MaaCustomAction.h for details about how to create a custom action.

name.Description: The name of the action that will be used to reference it.

Description.Brief: Unregister a custom action from the instance.

name.Description: The name of the action when it was registered.

Description.Brief: Clear all custom actions registered to the instance.
Post a task to the instance.
Details: The entry should be a task specified in the instance's resources. The param takes the same form as the pipeline json and will override the set parameters in the json file.

Description.Brief: Post a recognition to the instance.
Details: The entry should be a task specified in the instance's resources. The param takes the same form as the pipeline json and will override the set parameters in the json file.

Description.Brief: Post a action to the instance.
Details: The entry should be a task specified in the instance's resources. The param takes the same form as the pipeline json and will override the set parameters in the json file.

Description.Brief: Set the parameter of a task.
Details: See MaaPostTask() for details about the parameter.

Description.Brief: Get the status of a task identified by the id.
Wait for a task to finish.
Is maa running?
Post a stop signal to the instance.
Details: This immediately stops the instance and all its tasks.

Description.Brief: Get the resource handle of the instance.
Get the controller handle of the instance.
Create a resource.
Free the resource.
Add a path to the resource loading paths.
Clear the resource loading paths.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the resource is cleared successfully.

Description.Brief: Get the loading status of a resource identified by id.
Wait for a resource to be loaded.
Check if resources are loaded.
Set options for a given resource.
Details: This function requires a given set of option keys and value types, otherwise this will fail. See MaaResOptionEnum for details.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the option is set successfully.

res.Description: The handle of the resource to set options for.

val_size.Description: The size of the option value.

Description.Brief: Get the hash of the resource.

buffer.Description: The buffer where the hash will be written to.

Description.Brief: Get the task list of the resource.

buffer.Description: The buffer where the task list will be written to.

Description.Brief: The callback function type.

details_json.Description: The details in JSON format. See doc in MaaMsg.h

Description.Brief: Log dir
Details: value: string, eg: "C:\\Users\\Administrator\\Desktop\\log"; val_size: string length

Description.Brief: Whether to save draw
Details: value: bool, eg: true; val_size: sizeof(bool)

Description.Brief: Dump all screenshots and actions
Details: Recording will evaluate to true if any of this or MaaCtrlOptionEnum::MaaCtrlOption_Recording
is true. value: bool, eg: true; val_size: sizeof(bool)

Description.Brief: The level of log output to stdout
Details: value: MaaLoggingLevel, val_size: sizeof(MaaLoggingLevel)
default value is MaaLoggingLevel_Error

Description.Brief: Whether to show hit draw
Details: value: bool, eg: true; val_size: sizeof(bool)

Description.Brief: Whether to callback debug message
Details: value: bool, eg: true; val_size: sizeof(bool)

Description.Brief: Option keys for controller instance options. See MaaControllerSetOption().
Only one of long and short side can be set, and the other is automatically scaled according to the aspect ratio.
Details: value: int, eg: 1920; val_size: sizeof(int)

Description.Brief: Only one of long and short side can be set, and the other is automatically scaled according to the aspect ratio.
Details: value: int, eg: 1080; val_size: sizeof(int)

Description.Brief: For StartApp
Details: value: string, eg: "com.hypergryph.arknights/com.u8.sdk.U8UnityContext"; val_size: string
length

Description.Brief: For StopApp
Details: value: string, eg: "com.hypergryph.arknights"; val_size: string length

Description.Brief: Dump all screenshots and actions
Details: Recording will evaluate to true if any of this or
MaaGlobalOptionEnum::MaaGlobalOption_Recording is true.
value: bool, eg: true; val_size: sizeof(bool)

Description.Brief: ADB controller type.
Details: The ADB controller type consists of three parts: touch, key, and screencap. The touch part is used to control the touch events on the device. The key part is used to control the key events on the device. The screencap part is used to capture the screen of the device. The final value is the combination of the three parts as follows:
touch_type | key_type | screencap_type

Description.Brief: Win32 controller type.
Details: See AdbControllerTypeEnum to know how the value is composed.

Details: payload: { task_id: number, entry: string, uuid: string, hash: string, pre_hit_task: string, name: string, recognition: { id: number, box: [number, number, number, number], detail: string, hit: boolean, }, node_id: number, status: number, }

Description.Brief: The custom action API.
Details: To create a custom action, you need to implement this API.
You do not have to implement all the functions in this API. Instead, just implement the functions you need. Do note that if an unimplemented function is called, the framework will likely crash.

Description.Brief: The custom recognizer API.
Details: To create a custom recognizer, you need to implement this API.
You do not have to implement all the functions in this API. Instead, just implement the functions you need. Do note that if an unimplemented function is called, the framework will likely crash.
Write the recognition result to the out_box and return true if the recognition is successful. If the recognition fails, return false. You can also write details to the out_detail buffer.

Description.Brief: Get the version of the framework.
Set options globally.
Details: This function requires a given set of option keys and value types, otherwise this will fail. See MaaGlobalOptionEnum for details.

Types.MaaBool: Whether the option is set successfully.

val_size.Description: The size of the option value.

Description.Brief: Post a request to find all ADB devices.
Post a request to find all ADB devices with a given ADB path.
Check if the find device request is completed.
Wait for the find device request to complete.
Get the number of devices found.
Get the device name by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the device. The index should not exceed the number of devices found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Get the device ADB path by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the device. The index should not exceed the number of devices found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Get the device ADB serial by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the device. The index should not exceed the number of devices found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Get the device ADB controller type by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the device. The index should not exceed the number of devices found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Get the device ADB config by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the device. The index should not exceed the number of devices found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Find a win32 window by class name and window name.
Details: This function finds the function by exact match. See also MaaToolkitSearchWindow().

Types.MaaSize: The number of windows found that match the criteria. To get the corresponding window handle, use MaaToolkitGetWindow().

class_name.Description: The class name of the window. If passed an empty string, class name will not be filtered.

window_name.Description: The window name of the window. If passed an empty string, window name will not be filtered.

Description.Brief: Regex search a win32 window by class name and window name.
Details: This function searches the function by regex search. See also MaaToolkitFindWindow().

Types.MaaSize: The number of windows found that match the criteria. To get the corresponding window handle, use MaaToolkitGetWindow().

class_name.Description: The class name regex of the window. If passed an empty string, class name will not be filtered.

window_name.Description: The window name regex of the window. If passed an empty string, window name will not be filtered.

Description.Brief: List all windows.

Types.MaaSize: The number of windows found. To get the corresponding window handle, use

Description.Brief: Get the window handle by index.

index.Description: The 0-based index of the window. The index should not exceed the number of windows found otherwise out_of_range exception will be thrown.

Description.Brief: Get the window handle of the window under the cursor. This uses the WindowFromPoint() system API.
Get the desktop window handle. This uses the GetDesktopWindow() system API.
Get the foreground window handle. This uses the GetForegroundWindow() system API.
Get the window class name by hwnd.
Get the window window name by hwnd.
